conbody.p: Usually when an issue arises in Eucalyptus, you can find a pointer to the nature of the problem either in the Eucalyptus log files or in the system log files. By default, the Eucalyptus log files are stored in /var/log/eucalyptus/ on each machine that hosts a Eucalyptus component. If Eucalyptus is installed somewhere other than the filesystem root (/), these logs will be stored in $EUCALYPTUS/var/log/eucalyptus/.

Log Format
section.p: Eucalyptus logs now have a standard format, as follows:
section.codeblock: YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS LEVEL PROCESS:THREAD loggingMethodOrClass | the rest of the message ...

section.title: Configuring Logging
section.p: For the cluster controller and the node controller, log level is configured using the LOGLEVEL parameter in eucalyptus.conf. This parameter will be picked up dynamically when the value is changed in the config file, without requiring a restart of the component.

For all other components, the log level can be configured by passing an appropriate --log-level argument in the init script. It can also be dynamically changed using euca-modify-property to set an appropriate value for troubleshooting.euca_log_level. This takes precedence over the value specified in the init script. If no value is specified, the default INFO is used.
